optical_surface.comment: number of channel surfaces and temp https://jwst-docs.stsci.edu/display/JTI/NIRISS+Optics+and+Focal+Plane

slit_width.comment: Size of slit image in units of detector pixels - if set to 0 then assumes no slit used

dispersion.comment: Dispersion law. Val is the reference pixel, i.e. the centre of the array

wfno_x.comment: Image space f/# based on average of FWHM/lambda/1.02 for PSF for lambda from 1.114 to 2.744 https://jwst-docs.stsci.edu/display/JTI/NIRISS+Point+Spread+Functions#NIRISSPointSpreadFunctions-tab1

wfno_y.comment: Image space f/# based on 25 pix FWHM assuming lambda of 1.5 microns https://blogs.stsci.edu/newsletter/files/2015/02/SOSS.pdf vol 32 iss 1. Note this is used only for generating a PSF if WebbPSF PSF not used

osf.comment: Oversample each detector pixel by this amount. Need to be changed

qe.comment: this is the wavelength dependent QE per pixel; note this is null file for this mode, since it is subsumed in the PCE file

qe_rms_matrix_file.comment: [Default 'None'] Path to CSV file containing matrix of QE of pixels.

plate_scale_x.comment: based on published 0.0654 arcsec/pix from website https://jwst-docs.stsci.edu/display/JTI/NIRISS+Detector

plate_scale_y.comment: based on published 0.0658 arcsec/pix from website https://jwst-docs.stsci.edu/display/JTI/NIRISS+Detector

Idc.comment: Detector dark current in e/s based on NIRISS detector website https://jwst-docs.stsci.edu/near-infrared-imager-and-slitless-spectrograph/niriss-instrumentation/niriss-detector-overview/niriss-detector-performance#NIRISSDetectorPerformance-Darkcurrent

sigma_ro.comment: Detector readout frame noise in e-rms based on NIRISS detector website https://jwst-docs.stsci.edu/display/JTI/NIRISS+Detector+Performance

t_f.comment: use 2400.0 for paper reuslts - same for tf, tg, tsim

pc_fw.comment: maximum percent of full well to which any pixel can reach

nGND.comment: duration of reset event in units of frame time

nNDR0.comment: Integration time of zeroth NDR in units of frame time

nRST.comment: Time lapse between last NDR and reset in units of frame time
